title: Photothermal therapy offers an alternative to traditional cancer therapies
desc: Original story from NYU Abu Dhabi New light-based nanotechnology could enable more precise, less harmful cancer treatment. Researchers at NYU Abu Dhabi have developed a new light-based nanotechnology that could improve how certain cancers are detected and treated, offering a more precise and potentially less harmful alternative to chemotherapy, radiation, and surgery. title: Wait for IIUM study on KL mayoral elections, urges Nga
desc: The housing and local government minister calls for patience, says the Cabinet will decide on the best approach based on the study.

title: Fresh flying of flags in Moseley leaves community divided

title: RM2.4mil foreign currency smuggling bid foiled at KLIA
desc: PETALING JAYA: An attempt by a foreign man to smuggle foreign currencies worth RM2.4mil was foiled when he was arrested by the Malaysian Border Control and Protection Agency (AKPS) at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA), following an inspection operation at the Terminal 1 arrival hall on Friday (Feb 6).
